Name: Lakhwinder Singh Bal - Aug. 19, 2018
Description: The 48-year-old Surrey man died from serious injuries sustained in a fight near a McDonalds. Bal was known to police and investigators believe his murder was not a random act. Bal had a criminal record that included convictions for assault and uttering threats.

Name: Willis Hunt - Aug. 10, 2018
Description: The 33-year-old man was the victim of a deadly road rage incident. He was the passenger in a grey Toyota Matrix driving past the PNE when the driver accidentally cut off a white sedan. The driver turned on McGill Street, with the white sedan hot on their heels. Willis was shot after getting out of the car. It was Vancouver’s 14th homicide of the year.

Name: Leonardo Ngo - Aug. 6, 2018
Description: Police responding to a reported stabbing found a man who was suffering from serious injuries. He is expected to survive. A short time later, a second man, Ngo, 20, was dropped off at a hospital also suffering from serious injuries but did he did not survive. Ngo was known to police and investigators believe this was not a random incident.

Name: Gagandeep Singh Dhaliwal - Aug. 4, 2018
Description:
The 19-year-old was killed and another man injured after a shooting at a home in Abbotsford.
Police say it was a targeted incident.

Name: Chelsea Lynn De Forge - Aug. 1, 2018
Description:
The 31-year-old Vancouver woman was found dead at the Regal Hotel on Granville Street. Her death was Vancouver’s 13th homicide of 2018.
Police don’t believe this was a random event.

Name: Matthew Alexander Navas-Rivas - July 25, 2018
Description:
The 28-year-old man was slain outside a school in a targeted shooting. Navas-Rivas and a friend were walking their dogs in the area when a person approached Navas-Rivas and shot him.
Officers found him suffering gunshot wounds and he was taken to hospital but died a short time later. His friend was unharmed. Investigators said there was no further risk to the public. It was Vancouver’s 12th homicide of 2018.

Name: Aaliyah Rosa - July 22, 2018
Description: The seven-year-old girl was found dead at a Langley apartment where she llived. A 36-year-old woman who was also found at the scene received medical care, and investigators believe she was involved. Aaliyah and the woman knew each other. Police say the young girl’s death was an isolated incident.

Name: Unidentified man - July 1, 2018
Description: The 20-year-old man shot in Abbotsford later died in hospital. An 18-year-old man was arrested at the scene. Charges have not yet been laid. Police said the incident is not believed to be gang-related and the two men were known to each other.

Name: Shane John Tolmie - June 29, 2018
Description: The 26-year-old Vancouver resident died after a stabbing in an apartment. A 24-year-old woman was arrested at the scene. She has since been released pending further investigation. It is the city’s 11th homicide of the year.

Name: Abeal Negussie Abera - June 23, 2018
Description: During an altercation in Vancouver's Downtown Eastside, a 26-year-old Surrey man was injured critically and rushed to hospital with a stab wound. He died a week later from his injuries. No arrests were made though investigators believe it is a targeted attack and that there is no risk to the general public. It was the city’s 10th homicide of the year.

Name: Paul Bennett - June 23, 2018
Description: The 47-year-old Surrey man died of gunshot wounds after a shooting in his driveway. Bennett coached nine to 11-year-olds with the Cloverdale Titans Atom C team last season. Bennett’s death also sent shock waves through Peace Arch Hospital where he worked as a nurse. The Integrated Homicide Investigation Team released Bennett’s name to the public in hopes of getting clues to help determine motive for the shooting.

Name: Zacharia Nicolli Cross - June 7, 2018
Description: The 25-year-old Chilliwack man was found dead in a home, his injuries consistent with homicide, according to police. Police say the murder may have been targeted. Cross was known to police and associated with drug activity.

Name: Jaskarn (Jason) Singh Jhutty and Jaskaran (Jesse) Singh Bhangal - June 4, 2018
Description: Jhutty, 16, and Bhangal, 17, both Surrey high school students, were found at the side of the road in the 18800-block of 40th Avenue. Both had suffered gunshot wounds and were declared dead at the scene. The victims were not known to police but investigators believe the killings were targeted.

Name: Gregory Joseph Scuby- May 17, 2018
Description: The body of the 42-year-old Richmond man was found on a dirty road. Scuby was known to police.

Name: Amanjot Singh Hans - May 15, 2018
Description: The 31-year-old Surrey man was gunned down at a gas station in Langley. Police discovered Hans lying on the ground and  suffering gunshot wounds. He died in hospital.The Integrated Homicide Investigation Team believes the shooting was targeted. Soon after the shooting, the Langley RCMP was called about a burning dark-coloured Dodge pickup truck in the 8300-block of 196th Street.

Name: Keri Smith and Terrence Peter Smith - May 1, 2018
Description: The bodies of 36-year-old Keri Smith and 37-year-old Terrence Peter Smith were found inside a home by police responding to reported gunshots. IHIT says the couple had recently moved to Richmond from Surrey. They also have ties to Vernon. Both victims were known to police and investigators believe this was a targeted incident.

Name: Ian Roberts - April 30, 2018
Description: The body of the 43-year-old Delta man was found near the dykes in Pitt Meadows. Roberts was known to police and investigators believe the homicide was a targeted hit. Also on the same day his body was found, the Langley RCMP recovered a red 1996 GMC Jimmy that was associated to Roberts in the area of 56 Avenue and Logan Avenue.

Name: Christopher Thomas Schiller - April 26, 2018
Description: The 37-year-old Vancouver resident approached staff at the Parq Casino near Smithe Street and Pacific Boulevard seeking medical assistance. He was rushed to hospital for surgery, but died a short time later. Investigators followed a trail of blood to Cooper’s Park, just east of the Cambie Street Bridge near Marinaside Crescent, and believe that Schiller was involved in a confrontation there. But they have yet to determine what led to Schiller’s death, the eighth homicide in Vancouver this year.

Name: Amin Vinepal - April 26, 2018
Description: The body of the 24-year-old Delta resident was found on the road in Surrey. He appeared to have been shot. Around the same time a vehicle fire was reported in the 18700-block of 28th Avenue.

Name: Dam Minh Huu - April 22, 2018
Description: The 55-year-old male was found at Kingsway and Nanaimo streets at about 1:30 a.m. He was transported to hospital by paramedics but died. Charges of second-degree murder were later approved against Ngoc Chau Nguyen, 48. Police said the two men knew each other and got into an argument a few blocks away.

Name: Pardip Brar - March 9, 2018
Description: The 23-year-old Delta man was killed in a targeted, gang-related shooting in Newton. Investigators with the Integrated Homicide Investigation Team say Brar was known to police, had and investigators believe his murder was targeted and linked to other gang violence in the Lower Mainland. RCMP had previously alled Brar was involved in drug dealing. No arrests have been made. IHIT says a white sport utility vehicle and a black sedan were seen leaving the area after the shooting

Name: Donald Kelly - Feb. 16, 2018
Description: The 45-year-old Burnaby resident was fatally shot in Coquitlam. The victim was found inside a vehicle, while witnesses told police another vehicle was spotted speeding away. A short time later, Coquitlam RCMP located a sedan burning near Mariner Way and Dartmoor Drive. Police have not said whether the burning car is connected to the fatal shooting the same evening, but have said the shooting is believed to be targeted.

Name: Kaminder Rai - Feb. 15, 2018
Description: The 32-year-old man from Surrey was killed in a targeted shooting in Kerrisdale. He was identified online as a real estate agent. Rai was found suffering from a gunshot wound on Marguerite Street near West 49th Avenue just before 1 p.m. He was rushed to hospital, where he later died.

Name: Tarek Ali Al-Romeshi - Feb. 9, 2018
Description: The 23-year-old Surrey resident was found fatally wounded at a townhouse complex in the 8200-block of 204B Street. Police said he was found inside a vehicle with gunshot wounds. He was taken to hospital, where he was pronounced dead. Police believe the murder was targeted. A short time after the report of shots fired, the Langley RCMP received a call of a burning vehicle a short distance away. The burnt vehicle was a 2009 white Nissan 370Z.

Name: Unidentified man - Feb. 6, 2018
Description: The 51-year-old man suffered critical injuries in an assault outside the Astoria Hotel. Four days later, police confirmed the man had died. A 42-year-old Vancouver man was arrested at the scene and was later released pending further investigation.

Name: Cody Isaacson - Jan. 31, 2018
Description: The 28-year-old Chilliwack resident was found in a home after Chilliwack RCMP received reports of shots fired. He later died in hospital of his injuries. Isaacson is known to police. Police say they believe his murder was targetted.

Name: Kalwinder Thind – Jan. 27, 2018
Description: Thind, 23, was working at the Cabana nightclub, 1159 Granville Street, when a fight started outside about 2:30 a.m. He tried to break it up and ended up fatally stabbed.

Name: Sachdeep Singh Dhoot - Jan. 18, 2018
Description: The body of the 18-year-old Surrey resident was found inside the trunk of a stolen vehicle that had been abandoned in Vancouver. Police say it doesn't appear to be a random murder. Dhoot had been reported missing to the Surrey RCMP. He was last seen alive on Jan. 9 in Newton.

Name: Lovepreet “Jason” Dhaliwal - Jan. 19, 2018
Description: The 24-year-old was gunned down near Ridgeview Drive and Promontory Court. He was pronouced dead at the scene. Investigators are looking for information about a black Acura TL seen leaving the area immediately after the shooting. Dhaliwal was charged in 2012 with being unlawfully in a house and with disguising his face with intent. But the charges were dropped after new information became available.

Name: Kevin Whiteside and Alfred Wong - Jan. 13, 2018
Description: Whiteside, a 23-year-old Vancouver man who was known to police, died in a shooting that also killed one bystander and injured another. Police say Whiteside was exchanging gunfire with another person. Wong, a 15-year-old Coquitlam boy who was in a vehicle passing through the area, died two days later after also being shot. Another innocent bystander, a 30-year-old Vancouver man who was driving the area, was treated for minor injuries and released at the scene.

Name: Shawnn Patrick Cotter - Jan. 7, 2018
Description: The 37-year-old Surrey resident was found dead inside a home in the 17800-block of 64 Avenue. Police said they don't believe his death is random.

Name: Jwada Hedar-Kadhim - Jan. 2, 2018
Description: The 47-year-old was the victim in Metro Vancouver’s first homicide of 2018. Police responded to a report of a fight inside an apartment building. Hedar-Kadhim, who is known to police, was found lying inside the lobby, suffering from wounds sustained in a violent confrontation.

Name: Alexander Blanarou - Dec. 28, 2017
Description: The 24-year-old Surrey resident was fatally shot and his body was found near Bates Road and Harris Road. He was known to police . It's believed to be a targeted shooting.

Name: Manricco “Ricco” Sansalone - Dec. 22, 2017
Description: The young man died from gunshot wounds after making his way to Ridge Meadows hospital from nearby Kin Park, where the shooting is believed to have occurred at about 6 a.m. Sansalone is the son of one Hells Angel and the great-nephew of another. The young man had no criminal record, according to the online court database. But his father Joseph Sansalone and great-uncle Vincenzo “Jimmy” Sansalone are both members of the notorious biker gang’s Haney chapter.

Name: Gavinder Grewal- Dec. 22, 2017
Description: The 30-year-old North Vancouver man with gang ties was found dead in an apartment, police said. He was known to police and associated with gang activity.

Name: Orlando Ocampo - Dec. 20, 2017
Description: The 86-year-old Vancouver man was rushed to hospital and died of his injuries on Jan. 11, 2018 after an altercation weeks earlier outside Costco.  Vancouver resident,Thomas Stephen Toth, 58, was identified early in the investigation, and has since been charged with manslaughter. .

Name: Dai Duong - Dec. 7, 2017
Description: The 21-year-old Abbotsford man died after a shooting in Langley. Police say the death may be linked to recent gang violence in Metro Vancouver.

Name: John Davidson - Nov. 6, 2017
Description: The Abbotsford police officer was shot dead while responding to a call. The Alberta man accused of shooting him, 65-year-old Oscar Ferdinand Arfmann, has been charged with first-degree murder. The shooting followed a call to police about a possible stolen vehicle in the parking lot of a strip mall on Mount Lehman Road.

Name: Randeep Kang - Oct. 27, 2017
Description: The 27-year-old Vancouver resident was one of two men found suffering from gunshot injuries. He was pronounced dead at the scene. Kang was known to police and associated to gang activity. Investigators believe his murder was targeted and linked to other gang violence in the Lower Mainland.

Name: Nicholas Khabra - Oct. 23, 2017
Description: The 28-year-old Surrey man was the victim of a fatal shooting in a targeted attack that also wounded his female companion. The wounded woman called police from her vehicle a short distance away to say that she had also been shot. Khabra has a criminal history. In September 2018, a warrant was issued for the arrest of 27-year-old Brandon Nathan Teixeira who was charged with first degree murder in connection with Khabra's death.

Name: Marline Mars - Oct. 13, 2017
Description: The 34-year-old Vancouver resident was found dead inside a West End apartment. Paramedics on scene called police after they found the woman inside the home, along with other injured people who were considered witnesses. Investigators believe the attacker fled before first-responders arrived and that the incident wasn’t a random attack. It was the city’s 17th homicide of the year.

Name: Joseph Glen Jandrew - Oct. 13, 2017
Description: The 33-year-old man was rushed to hospital, where he died of his injuries from stab wounds. Investigators do not believe it was a random attack and are asking for more witnesses to come forward. No arrests have been made in Vancouver’s 16th homicide of 2017.

Name: Amjad Ibrahim - Oct. 10, 2017
Description: The 30-year-old Surrey man was known to police and investigators believe his murder was targeted. Ibrahim was associated with gangs, police said. His body was discovered in Garden City Park. It appeared he sustained gunshot wounds.

Name: Diana Mah-Jones and Richard Jones - Sept. 27, 2017
Description: The married couple age 65, and 68 were found dead in their home on Wednesday around 1:30 p.m. after police were called to check on the well-being of the Marpole residents. Police said the homicides, the city’s 14th and 15th of the year, appear to be random. Rocky Rambo Wei Nam Kam, a 25-year-old resident of Vancouver, was charged Nov. 7 with two counts of second-degree murder.

Name: Unidentified person - Sept. 18, 2017
Description: Three people were stabbed, one fatally, at a Kingsway sushi restaurant. The victim was stabbed to death inside Sushi Oyama (5152 Kingsway). Burnaby RCMP arrested a man a short distance from the scene. The two other victims suffered non-life threatening injuries, according to an RCMP release.

Name: Joseph Lucien De Carvalho - Sept. 18, 2017
Description: The 41-year-old Richmond man was found in the street suffering from gunshot wounds. He is known to police and his death was believed to be targeted. It was Richmond's seventh homicide of the year.

Name: Brandy Petrie and Avery Levely-Flescher - Sept. 1, 2017
Description: The 34-year-old Burnaby woman and 20-year-old Surrey man were found by police who responded to a report of shots fired at 232 Street and 64 Avenue in Langley. Both were suffering gunshot wounds. Neither survived. Days later, Langley resident Travis MacPhail was charged with two counts of second-degree murder along with additional charges of possession of a prohibited or restricted firearm, uttering threats and aggravated sexual assault.

Name: Sehajdeep Sidhu - Aug. 31, 2017
Description: The 18-year-old Abbotsford resident was found in a parked vehicle with gunshot wounds. He was pronounced deceased at scene. Sidhu did not have a criminal record but was known to police. Police believe his murder was targeted and is linked to other gang violence. Investigators have determined there were two other victims of the shooting and they are expected to survive. The suspect vehicle, a black Nissan Pathfinder, was located in the 27000 block of 60th Avenue in Langley approximately 30 minutes after the shooting.

Name: Pardeep Singh - Aug. 29, 2017
Description: The 22-year-old Surrey resident was shot to death in the driveway of his Cloverdale home. Singh was known to police and was associated to gangs. Investigators believe Singh’s murder was targeted.

Name: Roscoe Henry Carmack - Aug. 28, 2017
Description: The 53-year-old Vancouver resident was found dead inside a Downtown Eastside apartment. Randall Whitworth Hill, 34, had been charged with one count of second degree murder. It is the city's 13th homicide of the year.

Name: Tanner Krupa - August 20, 2017
Description: The body of the 19-year-old from Edmonton was found in an alley by Surrey RCMP who were responding to a report of an altercation. He had suffered injuries consistent with homicide.

Name: Chelsey Gauthier - Aug. 16, 2017
Description: The 22-year-old, was reported missing to the Abbotsford Police Department on July 27. A body was found by APD investigators on Aug. 16 in an area of Mission near Sylvester Road and Dale Road. On Aug. 24, IHIT investigators confirmed the identity of the dead woman to be Gauthier through DNA analysis. Police said evidence suggests her death was not random.

Name: Jaspreet Sidhu - August 4, 2017
Description: The 18-year-old Abbotsford resident was shot about 3:15 p.m. while driving a Chrysler 300. He died of his wounds in hospital. The teen was known to police as being involved in gang activity; the shooting is not believed to be random.

Name: Bhavkiran (Kiran) Dhesi - Aug. 2, 2017
Description:
The 19-year-old Surrey woman was last seen when she left home to have dinner with friends.
Just three hours later, her body was found inside a vehicle that had been on fire in South Surrey. Homicide investigators have said the death is not random and that it is not gang related.

Name: Yee Hung (Roland) Chin - July 21, 2017
Description: The 33-year-old man died in hospital after being shot in the 43900 block of Progress Way. Chin had most recently lived in Chilliwack and was known to police. Chin had an extensive criminal history in Calgary.

Name: Marrisa Shen - July 19, 2017
Description: The body of the 13-year-old Burnaby girl was found in Central Park shortly after she was reported missing. Police say it was a random attack. In September 2018, Ibrahim Ali, 28, was charged with first-degree murder in her death. Ali was a Syrian refugee living in Burnaby.

Name: Michael Page-Vincelli - July 12, 2017
Description: The 22-year-old died following an altercation inside a Starbucks coffee shop. Witnesses say he was left unconscious and bleeding on the floor. Manslaughter charges were secured several months later against Lawrence Alvin Sharpe, 40, and Oldouz Pournouruz, 35.

Name: Sandra McInnes and Neil Croker - July 9, 2017
Description: Vancouver police were called to an apartment at 1835 Morton Avenue, near English Bay beach, and discovered the bodies of a 57-year-old woman and a 51-year-old man, both residents of Vancouver. Leonard Landrick, 73, has been charged with two counts of second-degree murder.  Police said the victims and the accused knew each other and that all three lived in the same building, though police did not say whether the trio lived on the same floor or whether any of them shared an apartment.

Name: Unidentified man - July 8, 2017
Description: The male victim was found suffering from serious stab wounds. He was taken to hospital but did not survive. The Integrated Homicide Investigation Team said early indications are the attack was not random.

Name: Doug Presseau and Steve Drage - July 7, 2017
Description: Presseau, a 46-year-old Chilliwack resident, was one of two men stabbed to death during an altercation at the corner of Young Road and Princess Avenue. Another man, 51-year-old Steve Drage, also died of stabbed wounds, while a 26-year-old woman was treated in hospital for her injuries. The Integrated Homicide Investigation Team says police responding to a report of a fight found three people with stab wounds, and two of them died of their injuries. Chilliwack residents Kirkland Joseph Russell, 34, and Victoria Sherri Purcell, 29, have been charged with the second degree murder of Presseau. The investigation into Drage’s death continues.

Name: Clarence John Crothers - July 4, 2017
Description: The body of the 62-year-old was found by Abbotsford police inside an apartment in the 33000-block of Braun Avenue. Police aren't saying how Crothers died, only that his injuries were “consistent with homicide.”

Name: Mark Eriksen - June 27, 2017
Description: The 51-year-old Vancouver man who suffered serious injuries in an assault later died in hospital. It was Vancouver’s ninth homicide victim of 2017.

Name: Tyler Joseph Pastuck - June 9, 2017
Description: The  31-year-old Victoria man was shot to death just before midnight outside the Brown’s Socialhouse in Langley. A second man, Kyle Gianis, was wounded in the shooting and remains in hospital. Both men have criminal ties.

Name: Nektarios Pardalis - May 30, 2017
Description: Abbotsford RCMP discovered the 41-year-old's body inside his Cameron Crescent residence after responding to "a suspicious circumstance" at the home.Details on the cause of death or what led police to believe it was a homicide have not been released. No suspects have been identified at this time.

Name: Janice Nicole Bryant - May 23, 2017
Description: The  33-year-old Vancouver resident was shot near East 7th and St. Catherines Street around 5 p.m. She died later in hospital. It was Vancouver's eighth homicide of 2017.

Name: Jasdeep Singh Klair - May 14, 2017
Description: The body of the 24-year-old man was found in a silver BMW that crashed into a property near Granville Avenue and No. 2 Road. Mounties say they were called to the area after receiving reports of shots fired. Police believe Klair, who was known to police due to multiple drug convictions for both possession and trafficking, was shot while driving his vehicle.

Name: Muzaffer Darwaish - April 24, 2017
Description: The 28-year-old Richmond man’s body was found on the banks of the Fraser River in Terra Nova Park. Richmond RCMP says it appears to have been a targeted killing and that Darwaish was known to police.

Name: Pardeep “Terry” Dulay - April 15, 2017
Description: Police and the B.C. Ambulance Service were called to the Fraserview Hall during a wedding celebration after the 41-year-old Richmond resident was found dead by fellow party guests. It was originally believed that Dulay died of natural causes, but police say further information collected at the scene showed the victim had been involved in a physical altercation just prior to his death. In late June, police arrested 28-year-old Aneil Sanghera and charged him with manslaughter.

Name: Tyrell Michael Sinnott - April 1, 2017
Description: The 20-year-old Surrey resident died from gunshot injuries at the scene of the shooting. Sinnott had a criminal record, and was involved in the drug trade. Police believe his murder was targeted.

Name: Jaspreet “Jesse” Dhaliwal - March 26, 2017
Description: The 36-year-old man was found by police inside a Surrey home suffering from wounds received from an edged weapon. He later died in hospital from his injuries. A male suspect was taken into custody by police at the scene. Gurtarn “Tarn” Sandhu has been charged with manslaughter. Police said "the altercation occurred between parties known to each other, and was not random."

Name: Jaskarn Lally - March 24, 2017
Description: The 20-year-old Abbotsford resident was found dead in a home from gunshot wounds. Police suspect his death was targeted. Police said Lally was known to police,and was associated with local gangs

Name: Unidentified man - March 14, 2017
Description: The man was stabbed outside 139 East Hastings Street, the Insite supervised injection site, at 3:30 a.m. He was found on the ground, suffering from a serious stab wound.  He later died in hospital. It was Vancouver's seventh homicide of 2017.

Name: Birinderjeet Justin Bhangu - March 13, 2017
Description: The 29-year-old Surrey resident was fatally shot just before 2:30 p.m. outside the Comfort Inn Hotel. Police found him in a vehicle. Johnny Steven Drynock, 22, is facing one count of first-degree murder. Bhangu has a lengthy criminal history dating back more than a decade.

Name: Navdip Singh Sanghera - March 9, 2017
Description: Sanghera, 32, was in a white sedan with Harjit Singh Mann, 49, when it was sprayed by gunfire about 9:30 p.m. on East 31st Avenue near Ross Street. Mann, who lived in Surrey, died at the scene, while Sanghera was taken to hospital and died early the next day. Vancouver police said both the major crime unit and gang squad are investigating the murders — the city’s fifth and sixth homicides of 2017. No suspect descriptions have been released and no arrests have been made.

Name: Harjit Singh Mann - March 9, 2017
Description: Harjit Singh Mann, 49, was in a white sedan with gangster Navdip Singh Sanghera, 32, when it was sprayed by gunfire about 9:30 p.m. on East 31st Avenue near Ross Street. Mann, who lived in Surrey, died at the scene, while Sanghera was taken to hospital and died early the next day. Vancouver police said both the major crime unit and gang squad are investigating the murders — the city’s fifth and sixth homicides of 2017. No suspect descriptions have been released and no arrests have been made.

Name: Sofien Kazdaghli - March 4, 2017
Description: The body of the 39--year-old Vancouver resident was found  in a condominium complex. On th following day, 21-year-old Vancouver resident Diego Alphonso Huerta was arrested as he was about to board a Greyhound bus out of the city. He has been charged with second-degree murder.

Name: Joseph Kellington - March 3, 2017
Description: The body of the 24-year-old  Mission resident was found March 3 in Abbotsford. Police said his murder appears to be targeted. Kellington was reported missing to the Mission RCMP on Jan. 31. He was last confirmed alive on Jan. 29 in the Abbotsford area.

Name: Allen William Skedden - March 2, 2017
Description:
The body of the 52-year-old Delta man was found in the 22,000-block of Fraserwood Way.
Skedden was last seen Feb. 21, the same day he was reported missing to the Delta Police Department.

Name: Parveen Maan - Feb. 23, 2017
Description: The 45-year-old victim was found dead by Burnaby RCMP officers called to a report of a domestic dispute at a residence in the 7900 block of 18th Avenue. A male suspect, the deceased’s husband who has the same name as his wife, was arrested at the scene.  He was charged with second degree murder and remains in custody. A court date for his next appearance has yet to be scheduled.

Name: Satkar Singh Sidhu - Feb. 20, 2017
Description: The 23-year-old man was gunned down  on Steelhead Court in Abbotsford. Police said he was pronounced dead at the scene. Responding officers pursued a vehicle that was spotted speeding away from the scene onto Highway 11 and into Mission. Mission RCMP used a spike belt to disable the vehicle. Three male suspects were arrested. Police believe Sidhu’s murder was targeted and is linked to other gang violence that has occurred in the Lower Mainland.

Name: Shawn Curtis George - Feb. 11, 2017
Description: The 44-year-old Tri-Cities resident was found dead in 1300 block of Laurier Avenue, on a trail nearby the Hyde Creek Recreation Centre. He appeared to have suffered injuries from foul play.

Name: Maninder Singh Braich - Feb. 9, 2017
Description: Just after midnight, police responded to a report of an injured man at a home near Prince Albert Street and East 49th Avenue. The 38-year-old Vancouver resident was rushed to hospital and died shortly after. No arrests have been made but, based on the investigation, police don’t believe the public is at risk. It was Vancouver's third homicide of 2017.

Name: Lubo Kunik - Feb. 1, 2017
Description: The 61-year-old downtown Vancouver resident was stabbed to death in Stanley Park. Kunik was suffering from stab wounds when he was discovered by a pedestrian just before 11 p.m. along the seawall between Second and Third Beach. He was later pronounced dead at that location. He was Vancouver’s second homicide victim of 2017. Tyler Anthony Lagimodiere, 29, was charged with first-degree murder in January, 2018. Police believe it was a random crime.

Name: Francis Son Le - Jan. 27, 2017
Description: Le, 24, was found in the parking lot of Richmond General Hospital suffering from stab wounds. He died from his injuries. Le has a criminal record for trafficking and extortion using a firearm. Police said his death “appears to be targeted,” but not related to Richmond’s two earlier murders in 2017.

Name: Joseph Billy Bustinski - Jan. 27, 2017
Description: The 62-year-old died in a fatal shooting in Vancouver. Vancouver Police officers were called to the Savoy Hotel just before 10:30 p.m. and found the place full of bear spray and patrons struggling to breath. Police discovered Bustinski  inside the hotel suffering from a gunshot wound. He later died from his injuries. Police say the murder appears targetted. Stephen Farmer of Vancouver, 31, was arrested July 21, 2017 at a home in Surrey on a warrant for second-degree murder, according to the Vancouver Police Department.  On July 13, Marnie Marie Scow, 29, turned herself in and was charged with manslaughter for the same crime.

Name: Hershan “Shawn” Bains - Jan. 27, 2017
Description: The 36-year-old Maple Ridge resident was found dead from gunshot wounds in a vehicle in Surrey. Police believe the shooting was a targeted act.

Name: Karanpartap Singh Waraich - Jan. 23, 2017
Description: The 22-year-old shooting victim was found in a vehicle that crashed into the golden arches sign at a McDonald’s restaurant. He died at the scene. Police believe it was a targeted homicide.

Name: Martin Shen - Jan. 16, 2017
Description: The 43-year-old was killed inside his office on Viking Way on Jan. 16. De Kai Liang, 55, has been charged with second-degree murder. Police say the motive was a personal dispute.

Name: Calvin Chi Hang Zhao - Jan. 10, 2017
Description: The 21-year-old Vancouver resident was found dead in a Jeep of gunshot wounds by RCMP officers responding to several calls about gunshots. Police believe it was a targeted homicide.

Name: Russ Armfelt - Dec. 11, 2016
Description: A 53-year-old Delta man died after a fight outside the Rose and Crown Pub in Tsawwassen. Franco Sarra , a 20-year old man from Burnaby, was charged with manslaughter in February, 2018.  Police say Armfelt and Sarra were known to each other.

Name: Donna Humeny - Dec. 6, 2016
Description: Police were called to a home where they found the body of the 71-year-old woman. In June of 2017 Gordon Humeny was charged with second-degree murder. It was Vancouver’s 11th homicide of 2016.

Name: Lucito Santos Castillo - Dec. 4, 2016
Description: Castillo, 42, was found just before 10:30 a.m. in an apartment complex suite located in the 20100-block of 56th Avenue in Langley. Castillo was also known as Cheeko or RJ.

Name: Lisa Dawn MacPherson - Nov. 28, 2016
Description: The burned body of the 41-year-old North Vancouver resident was found in a shelter along the Lynn Creek near Keith Road. When police arrived, it was quickly determined that the individual was the victim of a homicide. MacPherson was last seen in North Vancouver on November 24, 2016

Name: Jia Hong Chen - Nov. 1, 2016
Description: Shortly after 2 a.m. on Nov. 1, two groups of men got into an altercation near the taxi stand at the Plaza of Nations at 750 Pacific Blvd. When officers arrived, they found two men with serious stab wounds. One of those men, 25-year-old Jia Hong Chen from Burnaby, died from his injuries. A 23-year-old man was wounded. A third man showed up at Burnaby General Hospital a few hours later with stab wounds.

Name: Greg Lupel - Nov. 25, 2016
Description: Police and ambulance attendants were called about an unresponsive male near the Safeway located at 88th Avenue and 152nd Street in Surrey. The man, later identified as Greg Lupel, 27, died at the scene. IHIT took over the file as the death was labelled suspicious.

Name: Unidentified man - Nov. 8, 2016
Description: The man was killed in a late-night altercation in New Westminster. Police were called to a home at 3:40 a.m. to assist the B.C. Ambulance Service with a male victim who sustained injuries during an altercation. He later died from injuries. A suspect was arrested at the scene. Police say the homicide does not appear to be random.

Name: Bradley Allan Nielsen - Nov. 1, 2016
Description: The 53-year-old man was found dead in a Maple Ridge scrapyard. Police believe it was a targeted attack, although the motive remains unclear. He was last seen alive on Oct. 31.

Name: Letisha Reimer - Nov. 1, 2016
Description: The 13-year-old girl was fatally stabbed in the foyer of Abbotsford Secondary School. A 14-year-old girl was also injured. Police and school district officials have said a homeless man walked into the school and attacked the girls before staff confronted and restrained him. The attack appeared to be random, police said. Gabriel Klein, 21, faces one charge each of second-degree murder and aggravated assault.

Name: Ashim Raza and Vikram Toor - Oct. 28, 2016
Description: Raza, 19, and Toor, 24, were found in the Fraser Heights area of Surrey suffering from gunshot wounds. One of them was pronounced dead at the scene, while the other was taken to hospital, where he later died. Police believe the shooting was independent from the gangland violence that had rocked the Lower Mainland in the previous weeks.

Name: Rickey Gordon Melanson - Oct. 24, 2016
Description: Burnaby RCMP responded to a report of a double stabbing at a homeless camp in the area of Rumble Street and Griffith Drive. Melanson, 48, was pronounced deceased at the scene. A second man survived. Samuel James Calladine, has now been charged with manslaughter and aggravated assault. Calladine and Melanson had known each other for years, and had set up their tents in the ravine, police said.

Name: Shaun Alan Clary - Oct. 23, 2016
Description: The mutilated body of the 27-year-old gang associate was dumped on a rural Langley road. Postmedia confirmed with sources that he is affiliated with the Langley-based 856 Gang. Police were looking at whether Clary’s death and other violent attacks across Metro Vancouver were in retaliation for the earlier slaying in Langley of Hells Angel Bob Green.

Name: Unidentified person - Oct. 22, 2016
Description: Abbotsford Police were called to a wooded area in the 30900-block of Downes Road after human remains were found. IHIT was called in.

Name: Bob Green - Oct. 16, 2017
Description: Hells Angel Bob Green was shot dead during an all-night party at the clubhouse of the 856 Gang in Langley. 856 Gang member Jason Wallace turned himself into police the next day and was charged with second-degree murder. He pleaded guilty to manslaughter on Nov. 3, 2017 and was sentenced to six years, seven months in jail after receiving pretrial credit.

Name: Kevin William Knuff - Oct. 9, 2016
Description: Knuff, 56, was found dead in a ravine near a Burnaby homeless camp on the west side of North Road, south of Highway 1.

Name: Hee Sook Youn - Oct. 5, 2016
Description: Youn, 59, was found dead in her place of business on North Road in Burnaby. Police are trying to locate her ex-husband, 59-year-old Youngku Youn, who is a suspect in his wife's murder.

Name: Natsumi Kogawa - Sept. 30, 2016
Description: The body of the Japanese exchange student was found in a West End mansion. She had been reported missing by her boyfriend on Sept. 12. She was last seen in Burnaby five days earlier. William Victor Schneider, 48, was charged with indignity to a human body and is a suspect in her death.

Name: Candace Young - Sept. 29, 2016
Description: Young, 61, was found just after 6:30 a.m. when police were called to an apartment near Rupert Street and Vanness Avenue. She was pronounced dead at the scene. John Hendricks Onland, 54, was arrested inside the apartment and has been charged with manslaughter.

Name: Jonathan Patch - Sept. 24, 2016
Description: The 32-year-old with a criminal record was shot to death just after 2 a.m. near 243 Street and 102 Avenue in Maple Ridge. Dean Sahanovitch, 55, was later charged with murder.

Name: Jason Leigh Zellmer- Sept. 23, 2016
Description: Just after 6:30 a.m., Coquitlam RCMP responded to a report of an abandoned vehicle in the 4900-block of Quarry Road. Near the vehicle, they found the body of Zellmer, a Surrey resident known to police. IHIT was called in.

Name: Xuan Vanvy Bacao and Samantha Le - Sept. 17, 2016
Description: Vancouver police were called to a house on Dieppe Place, where officers found the body of Bacao, 24, and Le, 29. Officers also found a four-year-old child who was unharmed, but hiding from the violence that had occurred in the home. Evidence gathered by police showed that along with the two murders, a man had also been kidnapped from the home. Police believed the murders and abduction were targeted incidents. Two days later police rescued the kidnap victim and took several people into custody.

Name: Unidentified female- July 15, 2016
Description: Coquitlam RCMP responded to a 911 call in the 1100-block of Eagleridge Drive and found an unresponsive 22-year-old female inside the home. She was later pronounced dead from injuries she sustained. The suspect was later found floating dead in Buntzen Lake after an apparent murder-suicide. IHIT did not release their names.

Name: Troy Clysdale - Sept. 14, 2016
Description: The 49-year-old was one of two men who suffered stab wounds in an incident in Whalley. The second victim’s wounds were non-life threatening.  A male suspect, identified as 20 year old Boni-Muhammed Mutawakel, was arrested.

Name: Diane Kathleen Johner - Sept. 2, 2016
Description: Johner, 52, was in the 48000-block of Chilliwack Central Road with a 23-year-old man when the shots rang out. The man was taken to hospital in critical condition and Johner died at the scene. The man, a former MMA fighter from Abbotsford, had gang links but no criminal convictions.

Name: Gurdev (Dave) Hair - August 17, 2016
Description: Police were called to Abbotsford’s Crown Court, near Clearbrook Road, just after 9 p.m. They found Hair, 45, lying in a yard. He died in hospital. Hair was known to police. No arrests have been made.

Name: Lauren Lindsay McLellan - Aug. 11, 2016
Description: McLellan, 28, died in hospital after a physical altercation with a woman outside Caprice Nightclub just before 2 a.m. Twenty-nine-year-old Samantha Nadine Doolan has been charged with manslaughter.

Name: Robert Vidovich - Aug. 7, 2016
Description: The 55-year-old Coquitlam man died after a brawl outside a Port Coquitlam pub. Mounties were called to the 2000-block of Lougheed Highway just after 3:15 p.m. after reports of an altercation. Officers found Vidovich suffering from life-threatening injuries. He later died in hospital. Investigators said he was stabbed. James Meanny, 34, was later taken into custody.

Name: John Michael Murphy - Aug. 3, 2016
Description: Surrey RCMP responded to a report of an altercation between two cellmates at the Surrey Pretrial Services Centre about 7:30 p.m. Murphy, 25, died as a result of the injuries he sustained. Jordan Cole Burt, 22, was charged with second-degree murder.

Name: Sean Christopher Kelly - July 31, 2016
Description: The 27-year-old man died after a shooting in Surrey. Surrey Mounties, responding to a call about an injured man, found the victim suffering from gunshot wounds in the 13900-block Antrim Road just after 8 p.m. He was later pronounced dead. He has a lengthy criminal record, including firearm charges, drug possession for the purpose of trafficking and breaches of a court undertaking. The charges stemmed from incidents in Surrey and Delta.

Name: Jatinder (Michael) Sandhu - July 23, 2016
Description: The 28-year-old Surrey man with no links to an ongoing gang conflict may not have been the intended target of the killer or killers who sprayed the vehicle he was in with gunfire about 10:20 p.m. Police said the shooting in the 14300 block of 90A Avenue is believed to be part of an ongoing gang conflict involving street-level players in the drug trade.

Name: John Robert Oliver Anderson- July 13, 2016
Description: RCMP officers were called to a known drug house in the 8900-block of Glenwood Street in Chilliwack just after 11:30 a.m. They found Anderson, 40, in medical distress from injuries sustained in an attack. He died the same day. Two suspects, David (Yoda) McKay and Cydnie Markel-Rempel, fled the house and were later arrested. McKay was charged with murder and Markel-Rempel manslaughter.

Name: Unidentified female - July 10, 2016
Description: Port Moody Police were called to a domestic dispute in the 3300-block of Dewdney Trunk Road about 1:30 p.m. They found the house engulfed in flames with two adults inside. The victim was found inside suffering extensive burns. She died later that day. Her husband has been charged with murder and arson. A ban has been put on his name.

Name: Brendan Aditya Chand - July 3, 2016
Description: Chand, 27, was found lying near Bog Park in the 9700-block of 130th Street in Surrey just before 2 p.m. on July 3. Police believe he was shot the night before between 10:30 p.m. and midnight. Chand had a lengthy criminal record and was convicted of a 2011 shooting in Burnaby.

Name: Christopher Alexander Serrano - June 13, 2016
Description: The 29-year-old man died in a targeted shooting about 10 p.m. in Burnaby. He also used the surname of Hurtado. .A dark-coloured sedan was seen leaving the area.

Name: Justin Pauwat Chan - June 6, 2016
Description: The body of Chan, a 26-year-old Richmond resident, was found near the Fraser River. He was wrapped in black plastic and inside a sleeping bag near the Milltown Marina. Chan had links to gangs and the drug trade. Vancouver Police said his murder was targeted.

Name: Amar Singh Sandhu - June 5, 2016
Description: The Richmond developer, 56, was sprayed by gunfire as he stood beside his black pickup truck in the parking lot of the Ironwood Plaza. Police are looking for a male suspect in his early to mid 20s, about six feet tall, with a slim build. He was wearing a grey hoodie or coat, with medium to dark pants and possibly a baseball cap, she said.

Name: Unidentified man - May 31, 2016
Description: A 58-year-old man died after a fight with another man in Coquitlam at Brunette Avenue near Hillside Avenue just before 5:30 p.m. Police said the altercation was diffused quickly, but the man died at the scene. His name has not been released. The second man, 31, was taken into custody but police said charges couldn’t be supported at the time.

Name: Kennith King-Lok Leung - May 17, 2016
Description: Around 10:30 p.m., police were called to the 500-block of West 27th Avenue after receiving multiple calls of shots being fired. When officers arrived, they found a silver vehicle on the sidewalk, and Leung, 23, fatally wounded in the driver’s seat. He is known to the police and the shooting appears targeted.

Name: Unidentified man - May 11, 2016
Description: The man's body was found by farmworkers in a rural blueberry field in Abbotsford. The death appears suspicious.

Name: Unidentified man - May 3, 2016
Description: The 49-year-old man was fatally stabbed in the Salish Plaza downtown Chilliwack. Gerald Leslie Dolman, 63, has been charged with second-degree murder. Police believe the incident started after Dolman’s vehicle followed the victim’s car on Yale Road and that Dolman struck a cyclist while following the victim. The two cars collided in a parking lot at which point an altercation led to the death of the victim, whose name has not been released. It is believed the two men knew each other.

Name: Unidentified man - May 2, 2016
Description: A 32-year-old man sustained a fractured skull in an altercation with a relative in Surrey. He was later released from hospital but returned on May 12 with bleeding in the brain and subsequently died. Mandeep Bhatti, 29, was initially charged with aggravated assault, but the charge was upgraded to manslaughter. IHIT has not released the victim’s name.

Name: Unidentified man - May 1, 2016
Description: IHIT took over the investigation into the suspicious death of a 54-year-old man after an altercation outside a grocery store in Sevenoaks Shopping Centre on Sunday night in Abbotsford just before 8:30 p.m.

Name: Dave Williams - April 18, 2016
Description: The 33-year-old Chilliwack man was killed in what police say appears to be a targeted shooting. Police say the attack was likely linked to a disagreement. He suffered several gunshot wounds and died at the scene. Daniel Joseph Fabas, 34, was identified as a suspect and as an associate of Williams. In August 2016 Fabas was charged with second-degree murder.

Name: Neil Leslie - April 17, 2016
Description: Leslie died in hospital a few days after he was beaten in a living unit at North Fraser Pretrial Centre. Another prisoner, Zachariah Pakarinen, 27, has been charged with manslaughter in the attack.

Name: Ray Jopowicz - April 4, 2016
Description: Jopowicz, 41, was found dead on the Byrne Creek Trail in Burnaby after police received reports the night before of shots fired in the 7300-block Sandborne Avenue. He had been convicted in the United States of cocaine distribution and had links to organized crime. No charges have been laid.

Name: Vikki Heppner - March 29, 2016
Description: The 28-year-old woman's body was found near Stave Lake in Mission. Ryan Jack Armstrong,  a 29-year-old Burnaby man, has been charged with second-degree murder and indignity to a body. Police have not yet released the name of the woman, but say it appears the two knew each other and the woman was targeted.

Name: Unidentified woman - March 21, 2016
Description: A 53-year-old woman contacted Mission RCMP on March 11 to report that she had been assaulted by a male two days earlier while walking through Fenn Park. Ten days later, RCMP responded to a residence in the 33000-block of 3rd Avenue for a suspicious death investigation. The woman who had complained about the Fenn Park assault was found dead. An autopsy found that the cause of death was consistent with injuries the victim sustained in the earlier assault in the park.

Name: Unidentified woman - March 20, 2016
Description: A 61-year-old Surrey woman was killed in a domestic altercation in a home. Surrey Mounties arrested Sukhvir Badhesa, 39, who faces charges of second-degree murder, aggravated assault and uttering threats. A 35-year-old woman was taken to hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

Name: Ryan Hardy - March 20, 2016
Description: The 38-year-old man was fatally stabbed about 4:20 p.m. at Main and Hastings Street. He died later in hospital. No one has been charged yet.

Name: Unidentified male - March 11, 2016
Description: Surrey man was found dead from gunshot wounds after his car crashed on 79th Avenue and 123 Street in Surrey. IHIT has not released the victim’s name.

Name: Two unidentified males - March 10, 2016
Description: Two young men involved in the Townline Hill conflict, aged 21 and 22, died after being shot in the 33000-block of Hawthorne Avenue in Abbotsford. IHIT asked the public for help identifying a dark-coloured sedan that was driving erratically on Hawthorne Avenue at 9:20 p.m. IHIT has not released the names of either victim.

Name: Robinder Virk - March 3, 2016
Description: The remains of the missing Surrey man were discovered inside a known drug house in the 2000-block of Tsawwassen Drive in Delta. Virk, 32, was reported missing on Jan. 11, 2016, and was last seen on Jan. 3, 2016. While police announced the death was a suspected homicide, the cause of death has not yet been determined and the case remains a “suspicious death.” No charges have been laid.

Name: Adam Palsson - Feb. 27, 2016
Description: Ridge Meadows RCMP was called to the provincial jail just before 4:30 p.m. after Corrections staff reported that an altercation had resulted in one man’s death. Palsson, 27, was taken to Ridge Meadows Hospital where he was pronounced dead. No charges have been laid.

Name: Lois Unger - Feb. 24, 2016
Description: Chilliwack RCMP was called to a home in the 42000-block Yarrow Road, where the body of the 51-year-old woman was found. Clayton Jacob Warkentin, 19, was charged with murder and later sentenced to life in prison.  Although investigators aren’t revealing how Warkentin and the victim knew each other, they say that events leading up to the homicide suggest it was a result of domestic violence.

Name: David Delaney - Feb. 7, 2016
Description: Delaney, a chef in Coquitlam who lived in Abbotsford, was found dead in his apartment on Center Street on Feb. 23. Arrested months later and charged with his murder is Shayne Daniel Duncan McGenn, 33. Sarah Margaret Sather, 33, was charged with accessory after the fact.

Name: Christopher Denis Kwik - Jan. 31, 2016
Description: The 40-year-old was the victim of a fatal shooting inside an apartment in the historic Edwards Block at 2425 Granville St., just before 11 p.m. Kwik was not a resident of the building. Kwik was charged days earlier with three counts of possession for the purpose of trafficking. He was scheduled to make a first court appearance on Feb. 2. In March 2018, Surrey residents Gage McPake and Cody Stuiver were charged with second-degree murder in connection with Kwik's slaying.

Name: Unidentified woman - Jan. 26, 2016
Description: The 58-year-old victim was found in a home suffering from extensive injuries. A teenager has been charged with manslaughter in connection with the death. North Vancouver RCMP was called to a home in the 300-block of East 1st street after a 911 caller reported hearing a dispute and possible assault. Police forced their way into the apartment after hearing sounds of a struggle. Officers then saw a man jump over the balcony. He was later arrested by North Vancouver RCMP.

Name: Kevin Brunelle - Jan. 22, 2016
Description: The 36-year-old man was found dead in a Langley City hotel where he lived and worked. He was suffering from injuries, which he may have sustained during an assault the day before. After the assault, he was helped back to his room, and was not checked on until the following afternoon when he was found dead.

Name: Yonatan (JK) Kassa - Jan. 22, 2016
Description: A shooting in Port Coquitlam left the 30-year-old dead. Coquitlam RCMP responded to reports of gunshots in the 2100-block of Rindall Avenue shortly after 9 p.m. Police found the victim suffering from gunshot wounds. He died at the scene. Police say it is believed the shooting was related to criminal activity. Kassa had gang links and convictions for drug trafficking and a violent home invasion.

Name: Peter Bender - Dec. 19, 2015
Description: The 33-year-old Pitt Meadows man was found in a car at a Maple Ridge church parking lot. A team of police converged on the parking lot of the Haney Presbyterian Church on 216th Street following the shooting. In February 2016, Randy Scott, 29, was charged with second degree murder. IHIT says the homicide was a result of a domestic-related incident. Scott was charged after turning himself in to police.

Name: Cameron Leon - December 4, 2015
Description: The body of the 22-year-old was found in Mosquito Creek near Fell Avenue and 17th street in North Vancouver. There are no suspects.

Name: Surinderpal Hehar - November 21, 2015
Description: The 45-year-old longshoreman was shot to death just after getting picked up to go to work. The other man in the vehicle was also struck and injured in the shooting. Police say sit was a targetted shooting but they don't know the motive.

Name: Robert Boucher - Nov. 6, 2015
Description: The 31-year-old man died after an incident behind the Ivanhoe Pub in Vancouver. Police believe the man was involved in a dispute or altercation that spilled into the street after starting at a nearby rooming house. Sadie Taniskishayinew was charged with second-degree murder and later convicted of manslaughter. In February 2018 she was sentenced to four years in jail. The homicide was the 14th of the year in Vancouver.

Name: Peng Sun - Sept. 29, 2015
Description: The  body of the 22-year-old Chinese national was found on a quiet North Vancouver street in what police say was an abduction case.  Tian Yi Zhang, 23, of Richmond was charged with first-degree murder and kidnapping, while three other men were also arrested. Casey James Hiscoe, 21, was charged with kidnapping, and  Dyllan James Green, 20, and Jacob Michael Gorelik,18, were only charged with interfering with a body.

Name: Duy Ly Nguyen - Sept. 27, 2015
Description: A brazen shooting at a busy Vancouver shopping centre left the 30-year-old Ontario man with gang links dead. Police said the shooting is believed to be targeted and is likely the result of an ongoing gang conflict. There have been no arrests.

Name: Matthew Charles Miles - Sept. 18, 2015
Description: The Vancouver man was found dead inside a house in the 3800-block of Frances Street in Burnaby. Police tried to negotiate with Kenneth Robert Hanna, 48, who was holed up in the house. He was fatally shot by police. The Independent Investigations Office is investigating Hanna’s death while the Integrated Homicide Investigation Team is probing Miles’ murder.

Name: Ping Shun Ao - Sept. 2, 2015
Description: The 74-year-old innocent bystander was killed in a drive-by shooting targeting a neighbour's home. He was standing behind a gate in his side yard in the 3500-block of Promontory Court when shots rang out about 7:15. Several bullets also hit the targeted house next door, which police have visited several times during the lengthy dispute.

Name: David Urquhart - August 31, 2015
Description: The 35-year-old man last seen in Maple Ridge in August was in October confirmed as the victim of murder in Mission.A  hunter then discovered some human remains in the area of Norrish Creek Road, a remote logging road north of Mission. Police are looking for information in their investigation.

Name: David Hennessey - August 12, 2015
Description: The 27-year-old was found by police responding to a call about an altercation at a home. He was suffering from what appeared to be stab wounds and later died in hospital. Another man found at scene was also treated for injuries at hospital and later arrested for the alleged murder.

Name: Igor Bradaric - August 12, 2015
Description: Burnaby police responding to a call of shots fired found the 43-year-old man suffering from gunshot wounds. He later died. Police say it appears to be a targeted attack.

Name: Garth McDonald - August 11, 2015
Description: McDonald, a 60-year-old Vancouver resident, was killed by a punch to the head outside a Robson Street bar. He refused hospital treatment for what appeared to be a minor head injury after he was punched and knocked to the ground during an fight outside Shenanigans Nightclub on August 11. He was later found unresponsive on the floor of his West End apartment, and died of a serious brain bleed in hospital. The VPD recommended a manslaughter charge against a 26-year-old Vancouver man.

Name: Dominic Boateng - August 8, 2015
Description: The 47-year-old man died after a stabbing in Vancouver’s Downtown Eastside just after 6 p.m. Police say the attack appears to have been targeted. Charged with second-degree murder was Dennis Sleightholme, 34, of Vancouver.

Name: Samir Mokhtar - July 27, 2015
Description: The 20-year-old died about 9 p.m. on the side of the street on Seaforth Drive near Rupert Street after being shot. Police said the victim was known to police and was on bail at the time of his death on a charge of manslaughter for a fatal shooting in Burnaby nearly one year earlier. Mokhtar's shooting was targeted, police said. It was the city's 10th homicide of the year.

Name: Jason Nguyen - July 26, 2015
Description: The 15-year-old Jason Nguyen died after police and paramedics were called to a home on East 24th Avenue near Rupert Street around 3 p.m. after a family member found Nguyen seriously injured. The teenager was rushed to hospital but did not survive.  The death was initially considered suspicious, but later deemed a homicide, and it did not appear to be random, police said.

Name: Marcelino Perez-Rodriguez - July 17, 2015
Description: The 44-year-old man, who had recently arrived in Vancouver, was found dead in Vancouver’s Andy Livingstone Park. Matthew Brenner, 26, of Vancouver, was charged with murder.

Name: Iryna Gabalis and Israeli friend - July 16, 2015
Description: Gabalis, 56, and a man from Israel who had just arrived, were found dead in a home in the Westwood Plateau neighbourhood after reports of two fatalities. Gabalis’s former boyfriend Mo Salehi, 44, was charged in the slayings.

Name: Hanif Jessa - July 15, 2015
Description: The long-time night superintendents for street cleaning for the city of Vancouver was shot outside his Burnaby home. Sources say the suspect is a former city employee.

Name: Colin Hill - July 14, 2015
Description: The 42-year-old husband and father of two was shot dead as he was trying to stop a break-in at his home in Cloverdale.  22-year-old Khouri Lamar Green faces a second-degree murder charge. Police believe the homicide was random in nature, and noted that Hill and the suspect were not known to each other

Name: Edwin Shek-Yin Cheng - June 5, 2015
Description: The 42-year-old Richmond man was found dead inside a vehicle after a shooting in a Sikh temple parking lot in Richmond.  Cheng is known to police.

Name: Charan Dhandwar - June 3, 2015
Description: Charan Dhandwar, 79, was out for an evening walk in the 1500-block of Eighth Avenue when she was attacked just before 7 p.m. She died at the scene. Julien Cadrain Levasseur, 23, was charged with second-degree murder. He later pleaded guilty to manslaughter,  and on Jan. 30, 2017, .Levasseur was sentenced to six years in prison.

Name: Wells Tony Gallagher - June 1, 2015
Description: The 37-year-old homeless man was found lying on a sidewalk in critical condition after a fight in the 20300-block of Fraser Highway. He later died from his injuries. David Christopher Van Den Brink, of no fixed address, has been charged with second-degree murder.

Name: Redelma Belissario - May 19, 2015
Description: The 62-year-old was found deceased in a home and was believed to be the victim of foul play. Her 38-year-old son Darwin Lescano has been charged with second-degree murder. In March 2018, Lescano was found guilty of second degree murder.

Name: Guiseppe "Joe" Bengey Zecca - May 10, 2015
Description: The 38-year-old Abbotsford man was found by a driver who saw a man lying in the street on Lonzo.Road west of Sumas Way. Andre Provencal, 23, has been charged with two counts of assault with a weapon, uttering threats and possession of a weapon for a dangerous purpose. Shiloh Davidson has been charged with second degree murder.

Name: Cady Quaw - May 10, 2015
Description: The 23-year-old woman died in a domestic-related homicide in Surrey. Her husband,  Gordon Alexander David, also known as Alex David, 34, is wanted by police for manslaughter and aggravated assault in her death.

Name: Emily and Laurel Janzen - May 7, 2015
Description: Randy Janzen confessed on Facebook to killing his 19-year-old daughter, Emily, his wife, Laurel, and his sister, Shelly. He said he shot Emily in the head to relieve her of her chronic, debilitating pain and depression. He claimed to have shot his wife Laurel because “a mother should never have to hear the news her baby has died”, and then he killed Emily’s aunt to spare her the “shame” of his actions. Shelly, 53, was found dead in her home in Langley. Randy later was found dead.

Name: Shelly Janzen - May 7, 2015
Description: The lifetime Aldergrove resident, 53, is believed to have been killed by her brother, Randy Janzen. Randy confessed on Facebook to killing his daughter, Emily, his wife, Laurel, and his sister. He said he shot Emily in the head to relieve her of her chronic, debilitating pain and depression. He claimed to have shot his wife Laurel because “a mother should never have to hear the news her baby has died”, and then he killed Emily’s aunt to spare her the “shame” of his actions. He later died.

Name: Gang Yuan - May 2, 2015
Description: The 42-year-old was killed in a violent confrontation at a British Properties home at 963 King George’s Way. Li Zhao, a West Vancouver man, was charged with interfering with a body and second-degree murder. The charge of interfering with a dead body is connected to allegations  Zhao cut up his victim after death.

Name: Arun Paul Singh Bains - April 19, 2015
Description: The 22-year-old was fatally shot before 3 a.m. near 88th Avenue and 126th Street in a dispute linked to a violent clash between young drug dealers and a series of earlier shootings. The young man is the nephew of Surrey-Newton MLA Harry Bains.

Name: Eleanor Anthonysz - April 17, 2015
Description: The 33-year-old died in a fire in her mobile home in the 9200-block of Shook Road in Mission. Two children were taken to hospital. Walter Ramsey, 42, was charged with the murder. He faces one count of first-degree murder, two counts of attempted murder and one count of arson for allegedly setting the trailer home on fire.

Name: Elaine Leznoff and Kalvin Dosanjh-Leznoff- April 13, 2015
Description: The 66-year-old woman and her 13-year-old grandson died in a fire in Richmond. Her son-in-law, and Kalvin’s dad, Surjit Dosanjh, has been charged with second-degree murder. Dosanjh had been estranged from his family and was not residing in the home at the time of the fire.

Name: Elmer Libertino - April 16, 2015
Description: The fatally injured 33-year-old man was found lying in the middle of the intersection of Moscrop Street and Smith Avenue. Mounties came across the body while on patrol in the area shortly before 3 a.m. Jordan Braun, a 19-year-old Burnaby man, was charged with second degree murder in November 2016.

Name: Minh Thanh Doan - April 3, 2015
Description: The 37-year-old man was found suffering from serious head injuries in an east Vancouver parking lot. He later died in hospital. A suspect has been charged.

Name: Unidentified man - March 29, 2015
Description: The man was killed in a stabbing in Burnaby and a suspect in the slaying died after being shot by police. Mounties discovered the dead man in a home in the 6100 block of 14th Avenue just before 6 a.m. They also found two other men inside the home and attempted to arrest them; one man was shot during that encounter.

Name: Salamawit Girma - March 27, 2015
Description: The 25-year-old was found dead after a stabbing in a home near 127th Street and 103 Avenue in Surrey.

Name: Scott Singh and Tony Pelletier - March 14, 2015
Description: Singh, 24, and Pelletier, 37, were killed in a double stabbing at the West Hotel in Vancouver. The younger man died at the scene and the older man in hospital.

Name: Crystal Rose Paul - March 3, 2015
Description: The body of the 36-year-old mother of five was found in the basement suite of a home on East 22nd Avenue near Main Street. Detectives believe the woman was murdered. Police are asking for the public's help to locate 42 year-old Daniel Alphonse Paul, a suspect in the case.

Name: Vladimir Shevalev - March 1, 2015
Description: The 80-year-old man was found dead in his Coal Harbour apartment. Police initially believed the death was a result of natural causes, but later determined it was a homicide. The victim’s son, 19-year-old Alexander Konstanovich Shevalev, was charged with manslaughter.

Name: Michael Donald Amy - Feb. 27, 2015
Description: The body of the 34-year-old Abbotsford was found in an SUV in the 9500-block of 139th Street just before 10 a.m. Police don't believe the incident was random. Police say 44-year-old Donald Lyle Salahub, who  is wanted Canada-wide for violating his parole when he disappeared from a halfway house in February,  is also a person of interest in Amy's death.

Name: Alexander Renney - Feb. 23, 2015
Description: The body of the 20-year-old Surrey resident was found near a business in the 14000 block of River Road in Richmond. Police say the victim was likely targeted.

Name: Trevor Johnson - Feb. 19, 2015
Description: The 35-year-old man was stabbed to death at a gas station in Abbotsford.The victim was taken to hospital with critical injuries at about 10 p.m.  Police have arrested 30-year-old Abbotsford resident Thavone Junior Carlson, who faces a charge of second degree murder in the incident. The victim met the suspect at the gas station, a fight broke out and Johnson was allegedly stabbed.

Name: James Enright - Feb. 15, 2015
Description: The 27-year-old North Vancouver man was stabbed to death as he tried to help his friend during a scuffle at the Edmonds SkyTrain station in Burnaby. Police were called to the station at 12:47 a.m. in response to a report of a fight. They found an injured man, who was taken to hospital, but later died. Police said “this was a situation where Mr. Enright was in the wrong place at the wrong time, he died because he tried to help someone.” Jesse Evan Ali Sellam, 22, has been charged with second-degree murder and 18-year-old Taitusi Funaki Vikilani faces charges of manslaughter and assault causing bodily harm.

Name: Lorne Joseph Melting-Tallow - Feb. 11, 2015
Description: The 49-year-old man was found bleeding and unresponsive about 4 a.m. on a sidewalk in Vancouver’s Downtown Eastside. He is the city’s second homicide of the year.

Name: Stuart David Ellis - Jan. 12, 2015
Description: Police called to a car crash found the 39-year-old lone occupant of the vehicle had died from injuries not caused by the crash.

Name: Jeffery Scott Nasa-Dyke - Jan. 6, 2015
Description: The 49-year-old man's body was discovered at an apartment near Triumph and Nanaimo Street. A man living in the home was found by patrol officers near Wall Street and Dundas. He was taken into custody without incident. Kenneth Conrad Izzard, 29, is charged with manslaughterThe accused and the victim are known to each other and the homicide appears to be drug related.

Name: Arundeep Cheema - Jan. 1, 2015
Description: The 24-year-old Surrey resident was shot while seated in his vehicle in the driveway of a North Delta home he was visiting.Police say Cheema is known to them and the attack was targeted.

Name: Jaylen Sandhu - Dec. 18, 2014
Description: The 17-year-old Surrey resident died after being assaulted. In April 2016, an 18-year-old man was charged with second-degree murder in connection with Sandhu’s death

Name: Dario Bartoli - Dec. 13, 2014
Description: The 15-year-old Earl Marriott secondary student died in hospital following an assault in Bakerview Park in south Surrey at about 2:30 a.m. by a group of four or five people. No arrests have been made.

Name: Teagan Batstone - Dec. 10, 2014
Description: The eight-year-old girl's body was discovered in the trunk of her mother's car in Surrey. Lisa Batstone, 41, was charged with second-degree murder in the death of her daughter.

Name: David Thanh Lam - Nov. 25, 2014
Description: The Edmonton resident had been in B.C. for less than a week when his charred remains were found in Langley. The 34-year-old with a criminal history dating back to 1998 was visiting family on the Lower Mainland when he vanished. Lam was reported missing from Richmond  a day after a passerby came upon his badly-burned body in a wooded area near 248th Street and 64th Avenue in Langley.

Name: Jaswant Pandher - Nov. 23, 2014
Description: The 64-year-old was was found unresponsive inside the family's home in Surrey. Her husband, Harbans Singh Pandher, 67, was arrested at the house and charged with second degree murder.

Name: Barbara Whitlock - Nov. 8, 2014
Description: The woman's body was found in her home after an eight-hour police standoff in Vancouver's Dunbar area. Her son, Brian Whitlock, 28, was charged later in the day with second-degree .murder. In June 2017 he was found guilty.

Name: Larry Robert Mizen - Oct. 19, 2014
Description: The long-time street level enforcer was found dead in a Surrey basement suite — the victim of an apparent murder. Mizen, 55,  had more than a dozen convictions. No arrests were made in his death.

Name: Theoren Poitras - Oct. 2, 2014
Description: Poitras was found face down in a pool of blood in the northwest corner of RC Talmey Elementary School, in the 9500-block of Kilby Drive after area residents reported hearing shots fired. In 2015, Sean Jacob Lee Jennings, of Edmonton, was charged as the alleged shooter, and Peter Edmonds was charged with accessory after the fact in Poitras’s murder. In 2016, 25-year-old Edmonton resident David Nguyen was charged with first-degree murder.

Name: Louie Sparvier - Sept. 30, 2014
Description: The 29-year-old man was found by police responding to a dispute, involving weapons, at Lougheed Highway and Laity Street in Maple Ridge. A second man suffering from life threatening injuries was also located in the area. Police said the two men knew each other and a fight had ensued.

Name: Aladdin Ramadan - Sept. 25, 2014
Description: The 20-year-old was the victim of a late-night shooting in Burnaby in the Brentwood Mall area. Ramadan did not have a criminal record, but investigators “believe it to be a targeted shooting.” A 16-year-old male allegedly carrying a loaded handgun was arrested one week later.

Name: Birinder Khangura - Sept. 20, 2014
Description: The 29-year-old was found in his truck shortly after midnight suffering from gunshot wounds.

Name: Serena Vermeersch - Sept. 16, 2014
Description:
The Surrey teenager's body was found in the 14600 block of 66th Avenue in Newton after she was reported missing earlier that day.
Vermeersch, 17, was last spotted getting onto a bus at 64th Avenue and 128th Street at 8:10 p.m. Sept. 15. In 2017, Raymond Caissie, 43, pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in Vermeersch's death. Caissie had served his entire 22-year sentence for a violent sexual assault and kidnapping in Abbotsford, and had been out of prison for just 18 months in September 2014 when he was charged with the slaying of  Vermeersch.

Name: Jason Collett - Sept. 16, 2014
Description: The volunteer worker at the Last Door Recovery Society in New Westminster was found in a house in the 1100-block of Nanaimo Street in New Westminster. No arrests have been made.

Name: Abdul Sarwar - Sept. 15, 2014
Description: Sarwari, 23, was found dead outside an apartment complex where he lived in the 3900-block of Carrigan Court in Burnaby. RCMP received 911 calls about shots fired and a home invasion in the highrise complex about 10:30 p.m. When police arrived, they found Sarwari’s body outside the building.

Name: David Lee - Aug. 30, 2014
Description: The 18-year-old was stabbed just after 7:30 p.m. in the 6500-block of Mang Road. He did not have a criminal record. A second man suffered minor injuries from falling down. Police said a motive for Lee's death is not yet known and there have been no arrests or charges.

Name: Christian Klatt - August 16, 2014
Description: The 36-year-old homeless man was found dead  in a makeshift camp in New Westminster, the victim of an apparent homicide. Witnesses in Sapperton Landing phoned police after spotting Klatt's body on the north bank of the Fraser River.

Name: Edward Allen Bezell - Aug. 12, 2014
Description: The 55-year-old Surrey resident died after a dispute in a home in the 14000 block of 60 Avenue. His son, Ryan William Beauchamp, has been charged with second-degree murder.

Name: Jahanbakhsh Meshkati - Aug. 10, 2014
Description: The 46-year-old Toronto man was shot several times near 19th Avenue and Second Street in Burnaby just before 11 p.m. Investigators believe the attack was targeted, but have not commented on a possible motive for the shooting. No arrests have been made.

Name: Bruce Alexander Ridout - Aug. 10, 2014
Description: The 61-year-old man and two injured women were found in a home in the 900-block of Ash Street after RCMP were called to deal with a fight at that address. The man died at the scene while the two women were taken to hospital, where they were treated and released. Jeffrey Caille, 22, has been charged with one count of second degree murder. He is also charged with one count of assault causing bodily harm and two counts of assault.

Name: Richard Blackmon, Tyler Belcourt - Aug. 7, 2014
Description:
The 38-year-old Blackmon and 36-year-old Belcourt were killed and a third person injured in the shooting at the Hawthorne Manor apartment building in the 46100-block of Gore Avenue.
A Canada-wide arrest warrant has been issued for suspect Aaron James David Douglas, 33.

Name: Stacey Raymond King - Aug. 2, 2014
Description: The 45-year-old was stabbed multiple times in downtown Haney and died a short-time later in hospital. The attack was not random, police said. No arrest was made.

Name: Trevor Koehler - July 29, 2014
Description: Koehler, 33, was shot repeatedly on the doorstep of his Albion home, in the 10300 block of 240th Street, just before 10 p.m. on July 29. Despite life-saving efforts by emergency crews, he died at hospital. Police say the attack was not random. No arrest was made.

Name: Donald William Deweyn - July 25, 2014
Description: The 63-year-old died after being stabbed near 106 Avenue and 135A Street after an argument. On August 20, 2014,  23 year old Dylan Dempsey was charged with manslaughter in the death. Further investigation led to the arrest of 28 year old Tyson Cole who is also facing a charge of manslaughter in Deweyn's death.

Name: Narinder Kaur Kalsi - July 13, 2014
Description: The woman was taken off life support and pronounced dead roughly a week after being assaulted in a suspected domestic incident in her Surrey home. Her husband, Baldev Singh Kalsi, 66, was charged with second-degree murder.

Name: Deepak Chahal - June 19, 2014
Description: The 22-year-old man died after an apparent fight between two groups in the 13100-block of 65B Avenue in Newton. Sukhpreet “Jesse” Shergill of Surrey has been charged with manslaughter in connection with the death.

Name: Shaunce Poirier - June 16, 2014
Description: The 33-year-old Surrey man suffering from undisclosed life threatening injuries was found near the street and died later in hospital.

Name: Thanh Tung Tran - June 7, 2014
Description: The 33-year-old, the seventh murder victim in the city in 2014, was found lying in the front doorway of a Gladstone Street home by police responding to a call about gunshots. He was treated by paramedics but died at the scene.Tran was known to police. There were no arrests.

Name: Milton Reyes-Moraga - May 14, 2014
Description: The 39-year-old man was stabbed to death after a fight in a basement suite. He was aCanadian citizen originally from Nicaragua. There are no charges in the case

Name: Gregory Quesnelle - May 12, 2014
Description: The fatal shooting in Cloverdale of Quesnelle, 32, who was originally from southern Ontario, is related to a domestic dispute, police say. Police identified the suspect as 33-year-old Barrie McQuarrie.

Name: Thi Tam Nguyen - May 10, 2014
Description: The 27-year-old woman was found dead in a basement suite of a house on East 41st Avenue near Rupert Street. She was Vancouver's sixth homicide victim of the year. Her ex-husband Cong “Danny” Nguyen, 31, wanted in connection with the slaying, was found dead in Gladstone Park the next day in an apparent suicide.

Name: Jin Jenna Cheng - May 4, 2014
Description: A Richmond man allegedly used a cleaver to kill his wife in what the Crown is calling a case of “extreme domestic violence.” James Jian Hua Wu pleaded not guilty to the May 4, 2014 second-degree murder of his spouse. A jury found him guilty of the second-degree murder in November 2017. He was sentenced to life in prison with no parole eligibility for 12 years.

Name: Anne Shouchuk - May 1, 2014
Description: Kathleen Maximuik, 61, murdered her 81-year-old mother Anne Shouchuk in a Surrey home and then committed suicide. Maximuik had "been suffering from ongoing health concerns."

Name: Thi Yen Le - April 24, 2014
Description: The 33-year-old Surrey woman died in Vancouver's Stanley Park in a targeted homicide, police said. She was known to police and her death was not a random attack.

Name: Yin Nor Hsao - April 14, 2014
Description: The 63-year-old woman died in an attack at a Kingsway apartment. The woman's 33-year-old son has been charged with murder. The suspect, Ka Chi David Siu, was shot by police and survived. The woman's grandchild was also injured in the same attack, allegedly by the suspect.

Name: Tejinder Singh “Tee” Malli - March 10, 2014
Description: The 29 year-old man, who was once aligned with the Red Scorpion gang but went on to switch gang allegiances several times, was in a parked vehicle outside the Shaw Tower when suspects either walked up to the car or drove up and fired multiple rounds into the car. Malli died in hospital. A 28-year-old North Vancouver man inside the car was injured.

Name: Nicholas Hannon - Feb. 26, 2014
Description: The 19-year-old Langley man went missing in February 2014. The arrests of three men led police to his body, which was recovered in a heavily wooded area in the Morris Valley near Mission. Connor Campbell, 21, Bradley Flaherty, 20, and 20-year-old Keith Tankard are charged with the first-degree murder. Police say the four young men knew each other. No motive was revealed.

Name: Maja Paderewska - Feb. 23, 2014
Description: The 33-year-old Coquitlam resident was found dead in a home on the 2900 block of Panorama Drive. Her brother, Jarek Paderewski, 27, was arrested and charged with second degree murder.

Name: Barry Carl Hinchcliffe - Feb. 16, 2014
Description: Hinchcliffe, 44, vanished on Sept. 20, 2011, and his remains were found on the banks of the Fraser River in Abbotsford Feb. 16, 2014. Police suspect the Vancouver man was involved in the drug trade.

Name: Robert Tyson Smith - Feb. 9, 2014
Description: The 28-year-old Surrey man was the victim in Vancouver's first homicide of the year.
